info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 22 at 4:59PM EDT until June 22 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT FOR EASTERN SHENANDOAH...SOUTHWESTERN WARREN...NORTHEASTERN PAGE AND NORTHERN RAPPAHANNOCK COUNTIES... At 459 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Sperryville, or 13 miles south of Front Royal, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Bentonville, Browntown, Compton and Rileyville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
